00031 #include <vector>
00032 #include "../common/common.h"
00033 #include "../common/experiment.h"
00034 #include "../common/edei.h"

00036 using namespace std;
00037 
00038 
00040 struct clargs {
00041   Path command;               
00042   EDEIprocess::Component contrast; 
00043   Path Mlistname;                               
00044   Path Plistname;                               
00045   EDEIoptions edeiopt;            
00046   string slicedesc;                             
00047   Path outmask;                         
00048   bool beverbose;                               
00049   bool SaveInt;                                 
00050 
00052   clargs(int argc, char *argv[]);
00053 };
00054 
00055 
00056 clargs::
00057 clargs(int argc, char *argv[]) :
00058   beverbose(false),
00059   SaveInt(false),
00060   outmask("sino-<minus list>-@.tif"),
00061   contrast(EDEIprocess::REF)
00062 {
00063 
00064   poptmx::OptionTable table
00065         ("Forms EDEI-based sinogram(s).",
00066          "Performs following procedures:\n"
00067          "1) reads two text files describing the arrays of input files"
00068          " (foreground-background pairs) in minus and plus position of"
00069          " the analyzer crystal.\n"
00070          "2) removes the backgrounds in accordance with these files.\n"
00071          "3) performs the EDEI extraction of the requested contrast component.\n"
00072          "4) constructs the sinograms of the slices requested in the slice string.");
00073 
00074   table
00075         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "ARGUMENTS:")
00076         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &Mlistname, "minus list",
00077                  "List of the input images in the minus position.", "")
00078         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &Plistname, "plus list",
00079          "List of the input images in the plus position.", "")
00080         .add(poptmx::NOTE,     "",
00081                  "Arguments \"" + table.desc(&Mlistname) + "\""
00082                  " and \"" + table.desc(&Plistname) + "\". "
00083                  + AqSeries::Desc)
00084         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &outmask, "result mask",
00085                  "Output result mask.", MaskDesc, outmask)
00086 
00087         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "OPTIONS:")
00088         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &contrast, 'C', "contrast",
00089                  "Type of the contrast component.",
00090                  "The component of the contrast to extract via the (E)DEI method"
00091                  " and then reconstruct. " + EDEIprocess::componentDesc, toString(contrast))
00092     .add(poptmx::OPTION, &edeiopt.RCname, 0, "rc",
00093          EDEIoptions::rcOptionShortDesc, EDEIoptions::rcOptionDesc)
00094         .add(edeiopt.options())
00095         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &slicedesc, 's', "slice",
00096                  "Slices to be processed.", SliceOptionDesc, "<all>")
00097         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &SaveInt,'i', "int",
00098          "Output image(s) as integer.", IntOptionDesc)
00099         .add_standard_options(&beverbose)
00100         .add(poptmx::MAN, "SEE ALSO:", SeeAlsoList);
00101 
00102   if ( ! table.parse(argc,argv) )
00103         exit(0);
00104   if ( ! table.count() ) {
00105         table.usage();
00106         exit(0);
00107   }
00108 
00109   command = table.name();
00110 
00111   // <minus list> and <plus list> : required arguments.
00112   if ( ! table.count(&Mlistname) )
00113     exit_on_error(command, string () +
00114                                   "Missing required argument: "+table.desc(&Mlistname)+".");
00115   if ( ! table.count(&Plistname) )
00116     exit_on_error(command, string() +
00117                                   "Missing required argument: "+table.desc(&Plistname)+".");
00118 
00119 
00120   // <result mask> : one more argument may or may not exist
00121   if ( ! table.count(&outmask) )
00122         outmask = upgrade(Mlistname, "reconstructed-") + "-@.tif";
00123   if ( string(outmask).find('@') == string::npos )
00124         outmask = outmask.dtitle() + "-@" + outmask.extension();
00125 
00126 }
00127 
00128 
00129 
00131 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00132 
00133   const clargs args(argc, argv);
00134   const AqSeries Mlist(args.Mlistname);
00135   const AqSeries Plist(args.Plistname);
00136   const EDEIprocess proc(args.edeiopt.RCname, args.edeiopt.Gm, args.edeiopt.Gp,
00137                          args.edeiopt.mpinter, args.edeiopt.smooth, args.edeiopt.acof);
00138   const EDEIexp expr(proc, args.contrast, Mlist, Plist);
00139   int
00140     thetas=expr.thetas(),
00141     pixels=expr.pixels(),
00142     slices=expr.slices();
00143   const string sliceformat = mask2format(args.outmask, slices);
00144   const vector<int> sliceV = slice_str2vec(args.slicedesc, slices);
00145   const SinoS sins(expr, sliceV, args.beverbose);
00146 
00147   Map sinogram(thetas, pixels);
00148   ProgressBar bar(args.beverbose, "sinogram formation", sliceV.size());
00149 
00150   for (unsigned slice=0 ; slice < sliceV.size() ; slice++ ) {
00151         sins.sino(slice, sinogram);
00152         SaveImage( toString(sliceformat, sliceV[slice]+1), sinogram, args.SaveInt);
00153         bar.update();
00154   }
00155 
00156   exit(0);
00157 
00158 }
